lines.text: Say, Joan, do you remember me raving about an awfully nice man that I met in Boston?
The Boston rave - now, let me think a minute. I remember the Boston Tea Party! But, not the Boston rave.
By the way, what sort of impression did you get in meeting Jeff?
My impression is that he should be put in a medicine bottle. He's my idea of a perfect pill!
Joan, it's happened! It's happened!
Calm yourself, Lizzie.
He did it. He did it!
Elizabeth Prescott! I'm ashamed of you. You naughty girl!
He - he kissed me! Jeff kissed me.
Is that all? I thought something worthwhile had happened to you.
His kisses are the sincere kind. He's not like other men.
Well, I hope he's worthy of ya.
Hmm. I just hope that I'm worthy of him.
You get that right outta your noodle, right now. Cause you are - plenty!
Well, I'll be hornswoggled!
What's your name?
Oh, you wouldn't like it, really. It's an ugly name.
So long as it ain't horse radish, I'll like it all right.
We are different, Montana. Me and you - are different as - as velvet and cactus.
Not so different. Just a boy and a girl.

[Introducing Joan, aka "Montana"]
Fellas, I want to introduce you to Mrs. Larry Kerrigan.
Why, I'm a monkey's grandpa!
Boy, you sure did pick out a nice bit of sugar. That's about the sweetest Mama I ever did see on these prairies.
Oh, look! A female of the species!
Froggy, one more crack like that and somebody's gonna be fryin' your legs for dinner.
Larry, you don't understand. They're my friends! Well, they're all ladies and gentlemen.
Gentlemen? They ain't a man among 'em.
Larry!
They're nothin' but a bunch a low down, double-crossin' critters - as poisonous as a nest of measly rattlers! They ain't a one of 'em fit to even talk to ya or look at ya - let alone dance with ya.
My boy, why don't you have a talk with her? We all make mistakes.
That's just it. I made the mistake. I'm a sayin' I shouldn't 've gone and put a western saddle on a New York thoroughbred - unless I was mighty careful that the saddle fit mighty comfortable like.

[singing]
Plinky, plinky, plunk, plunk, ridin' the plain. Plinky, plinky, plunk, plunk, prayin' for rain. Nothin' but sun, nothin' but hills, trailin' in ol' Montana...
